ratings.comment: He's a sweet man who is very excited by genetics. His lectures were interesting, but not a lot of text on slides, so you really have to write your own notes. His tests are not easy, but they are very similar to the practice tests. He didn't let us use a note card. The first quiz generally gets very low scores on vocab, so study your vocab with him.

This class can be a little difficult since its only graded based on midterms and the final, but you are allowed to drop your lowest score and there is a curve. If you work hard from the start getting an A is possible. John has a clear passion for the subject and teaching, but some of the lectures are a bit dry and difficult to sit through.

Great lecturer, was dull but you knew what you were expected to know. He loves plants (he's a corn breeder) so I enjoyed his lectures. Made things very understandable. Stays on schedule and sticks to what he says. I would take another class with him. LOVED the fact that lowest quiz grade got dropped!

Co-teaches with the worst professor who is sure to make the class miserable and incredibly difficult, which sadly ends up overshadowing Doebly's good professorial qualities. But with that aside, Doebly is great - amiable, clear, funny. I especially enjoyed his qualitative genetics section. His exam questions are predictable and easy to study for.
Clear lecture. Easy exam if you did the daily practice sheet. Textbook never opened, nor the solution book. Check the discussion posts for the daily practice sheet answers.

He's an interactive lecturer, so I keeps you awake. His slides are extremely colorful and in really big font which can be a good thing or really messy. He also helps online through a chat on learn@UW, so it makes asking questions easier. Overall a good professor.

Doebley is pretty good, and he actually seems to realize that this stuff is hard for most people, unlike Laughon. Only complaint I have is that the class is fairly statistics-intensive, so much so that stats should probably be a prereq.
Class is hard, but Doebley realizes that. Definitely keep up with the reading and the assigned problems, exam problems tend to be pretty similar to the daily problems.
Very organized and really interesting material. I loved the class, but it requires effort to learn and understand the material.

This guy is great. He explains all his slides so well. He gives out handouts with additional problems, and they'll VERY similar to the exam problems. If you know how to do the handout problems, the exams are a breeze.

Professor Doebly is fantastic. His lectures are crystal clear and interesting. He speaks clearly and provides additional handouts for each lecture with practice problems and examples. A truly great and inspirational professor.
This is a hard class, but if you have to take it try to get in it with Doebly. The professor for the middle section was impossible but the first and last section by Doebly were very well taught!

Clear, engaging, helpful!  With a dry subject matter, this prof was still able to get some laughs.  Homework relevant to lecture, and exam questions often taken from it.  He is clearly passionate about teaching as well as genetics - he wants all students to do well.  Class is no cakewalk, but Doebley makes it as accessible as possible.

I'm not sure why anyone would complain about the math/stats in this class...it's not hard, and he explains it very well. Lectures are well-organized, expectations are clear, and exam questions were more than fair. His "handouts" made even the difficult concepts easy to understand. I would highly recommend him for this class.

He was alright.  The material was crap, and unfortunately for me, I had never taken a stats class before this..it should be a prereq..  Still, Doe Boy Fresh isn't bad. Plus it's fun to listen to him pronounce "Exom"
Very clear in lecture. Make sure you understand the statistics very well!
a great prof, a clear lecturer, exams not too bad but there were a few stumpers on them, overall, not too bad, i ended up with an AB in the class so it isnt hard to pass, believe me!!!

I liked John. I thought he did a good job and was very clear in his expectations. The course overall was a bit of a disappointment because of the middle section, but that had nothing to do with Prof. Doebly.

I am surprised at the other comments. His tests are difficult and based more-so on the statistics aspects than other genetics professors, but he is approachable and wants you to do well. If you go to his office hours he is excited to help and takes note of the fact you came-he writes down your name. Tests are based off  lectures notes - study those
Don't bother asking him for a letter of recommendation.  Good luck passing his exams.
Although not as bad as some professors for this course, he did a poor job in teaching and the exams for his sections were extremely difficult.
No Comments
